description.highlights: The MMCA Seoul is a representative institution of Korean modern art that introduces global contemporary art
description.spatial design: The design integrates with the superb natural landscape surrounding the site.
description.keywords: Korean art, MMCA, contemporary art, cultural platform, art, science, humanities, cultural experience

Facade.highlights: The highlight of this design is its clean, minimalist aesthetic with a large rectangular cutout that acts as an entrance or walkway.
Facade.shape: The building is predominantly rectangular with a strong geometric form.
Facade.spatial design: The utilization of a large, open cutout in the facade provides an interesting spatial dynamic that contrasts with the solid, uniform surfaces.
Facade.material design: The contrast between the smooth, uniform panels on the upper construction and the textured stone walls on the lower section is particularly striking.
Facade.keywords: Minimalist, Geometric, Rectangular, Contrasting materials, Textured stone, Smooth panels, Open facade

Interior.highlights: The highlight of this design is the vast, open, and well-lit gallery space that provides an unobstructed view of the artwork on display.
Interior.shape: The form is a large open rectangle with minimal structural interruptions, facilitating an expansive and flexible display area.
Interior.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form is the use of wide, open spaces with high ceilings and a grid of white columns that organize the space without overwhelming it.
Interior.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the combination of the wooden flooring, white walls, and ceiling with a grid of skylights that ensures even distribution of natural light.
Interior.keywords: Minimalist, Open Space, Natural Lighting, Flexible Layout, Modern, Column Grid, Wooden Flooring, White Walls, Skylights

Interior2.highlights: The highlight of this design is the grand spiral ramp and the large skylight that allows natural light to filter through to the exhibition space below.
Interior2.shape: The dominant form used in this design is circular, with smooth curves and a continuous flowing spiral structure.
Interior2.spatial design: The highlight of its shape and form is the open atrium in the center facilitated by the spiral ramp, which also functions as a viewing platform.
Interior2.material design: The highlight in its spatial and material design is the use of smooth, uniform surfaces, likely concrete or a similar material, that provide a monolithic and seamless appearance.
Interior2.keywords: Spiral, Atrium, Skylight, Natural light, Smooth surfaces, Flowing structure, Concrete, Monolithic, Exhibition space
